intro: Dorstenia buchananii var. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate arrowhead plant, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and long, slender peduncles that bear clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and unique growth form.
